TopicTitle: The KSP 1.0 Grand Discussion Thread: Conquering Space Was Never This Easy!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Still showing Server Migration for me. Despite DNS flush and clearing browser cache. No joy with neither Chrome or Firefox

same here...

I found using a different computer and searching through google for a link worked.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T18:22:38Z" title="04/27/2015 06:22  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by John FX**

5thHorseman found a workaround for those still having trouble:

> 
> Not all dns problems are on our computers. My ISP's DNS still has the wrong ip.
> For those still having problems, I added:
> 
> 85.236.103.6 kerbalspaceprogram.com
> 
> to my hosts file and got right on. If you do this, I'd suggest you remove it once you get the download.
Still nothing
It works again! AWYEA!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Still waiting. Flushed my browser cache and DNS cache, still getting the migration screen.
Restart browser Warshawski?

> 
> Restart browser Warshawski?

I've done that too and still got nothing
Website is still on the server migrating screen for me as well :/

Now that 1.0 is out, let this be a place were we can all talk about how far Kerbal Space Program has gone over the years.

From the Sun being a little piece of a decal in the sky, to a fully blown 3D interactable solar system, the game has gone far. And it's thanks to SQUAD.

Let us all talk about our memories like "Remember when..."

Let us all show our appreciation to SQUAD.***Ã¢â‚¬â€¹CHEERS!***

> 
> I've done that too and still got nothing

Clear the DNS cache, clear the browser cache and then try again.
I've got the migration screen over here, and no ungodly amount of F5-ing is changing it.
Installer downloaded, ready to begin install.
- [\*=left]***Fixed 'infiniglide' bug.***Rest in piece![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

> 
> Website is still on the server migrating screen for me as well :/

Is it possible that it simply isn't available for all areas yet?
Downloading, time to learn physics again! Hopefully my DMSP save still works!

> 
> Restart browser Warshawski?

I think I've already done that but there's no harm in trying again.

Edit: Nada. Cleared the caches, restarted, still nothing. I'm on the US West Coast (San Diego, to be exact).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T18:23:34Z" title="04/27/2015 06:23  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Warshawski**

> 
> 5thHorseman found a workaround for those still having trouble:

Yup. That worked for me. The installer is downloading. My personal hype hypensifies!
It loads really fast.
Downloaded!

For users running Mac using "sudo discoveryutil udnsflushcaches" in your terminal to clear the DNS cache. Website is working for me now that I've done that ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The launcher says it's "downloading patcher" but it doesn't seem to be doing anything.

- - - Updated - - -

Gave up on the launcher, EPIC LOAD SPEED!
The linear RCS now has an utility! it has 2\* the thrust of a basic rcs, and is also lighter, the rcs isn't massless anymore
And I'm still 5-6 hours from ending my workday and making it home
the navball is partially transparent!! That's nice.

**THE LAUNCHER INSTALLS .90!**

**notcaps.**
